title: UK parliament votes for assisted dying, paving way for historic law change
byline: Britain’s parliament voted on Friday in favour of a bill to legalise assisted dying, paving the way for the country’s biggest social change in a generation.

title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says that several spells of showers will occur in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy, Galle and Matara districts today.

title: Complaint filed with FCID against ex-President Maithripala
byline: The Vice Chairman of the Eppawala Cooperative Society, Lakshman Jayawardena has lodged a formal complaint with the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) concerning the alleged misappropriation of public funds by former President Maithripala Sirisena.

title: Earthquake hits northern Iran as Israeli air strikes continue
byline: A 5.1-magnitude earthquake struck northern Iran on Friday, while Israeli air strikes continued to hit the country.

title: TNL celebrates 32 years as Sri Lanka’s first private television broadcaster
byline: Today (21) marks the 32nd anniversary of TNL (Telshan Network Limited), Sri Lanka’s first private television media channel.

title: Police bust fake currency racket after suspect nabbed with counterfeit notes
byline: The Hatharaliyadda Police have uncovered a counterfeit currency note operation following a tip-off received last afternoon (20), concerning the circulation of fake currency in the area.

title: World Bank approves $150M program to support Sri Lanka’s clean energy transition
byline: The World Bank Group approved a new $150 million program to support Sri Lanka’s move toward clean, reliable, and affordable energy.

title: Iran, Israel launch new attacks after Tehran rules out nuclear talks
byline: Iran and Israel exchanged fresh attacks early on Saturday, a day after Tehran said it would not negotiate over its nuclear programme while under threat and Europe tried to keep peace talks alive.

title: Valid Israeli visa mandatory for Sri Lankans exiting via Egypt - Embassy
byline: The Sri Lankan Embassy in Israel has announced that it is now mandatory for Sri Lankans intending to travel from Israel to Sri Lanka via Egypt to possess a valid Israeli visa, in light of the prevailing security situation and regional travel complications.

title: India to help in evacuating Sri Lankan nationals from Iran
byline: Following formal requests from the Governments of Nepal and Sri Lanka, the Indian Embassy in Tehran on Saturday said that it will now extend its evacuation efforts under Operation Sindhu to include citizens from both neighbouring countries.

title: 16 billion login credentials from Google and other sites leaked online, report says
byline: Sixteen billion login credentials have been leaked and compiled into datasets online, giving criminals “unprecedented access” to accounts consumers use each day, according to researchers at cybersecurity outlet Cybernews.

title: ADB pledges full support for Sri Lanka’s new education reforms
byline: The representatives of the Asian Development Bank (ADB) have expressed their full support for the new education reforms undertaken by the Minister of Education, Higher Education, and Vocational Training, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya alongside the current government.

title: Pakistan to nominate Trump for Nobel Peace Prize
byline: Pakistan said on Saturday it would recommend U.S. President Donald Trump for the Nobel Peace Prize, an accolade that he has said he craves, for his work in helping to resolve the recent conflict between India and Pakistan.

title: Apple sued by shareholders for allegedly overstating AI progress
byline: Apple was sued on Friday by shareholders in a proposed securities fraud class action that accused it of downplaying how long it needed to integrate advanced artificial intelligence into its Siri voice assistant, hurting iPhone sales and its stock price.

title: 21 underage children taken into custody while begging and vending on streets
byline: Sri Lanka Police have taken into custody 21 underage children who were found begging and selling goods on the streets under unsafe conditions.

title: SriLankan Airlines’ newly acquired Airbus completes maiden flight
byline: SriLankan Airlines’ newly acquired Airbus A330-200 wide-body aircraft successfully completed its maiden commercial flight, departing from Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake to Malé International Airport in the Maldives.

title: Two dead, over 25 injured in bus accident in Badulla
byline: At least two persons have been killed while over 25 persons have been injured and hospitalised following a bus accident at Dunhinda in Badulla.
